DOC.brief_summary: In 6-week experimental design , 90 adult couple one partner Type 2 Diabetes ( T2D ) randomly assign either collaborative implementation intention ( Collaborative IIs ) , Individual Implementation Intentions ( Individual IIs ) condition , control condition . As pilot study , randomization experimental group vs control group occur 2:1 ratio . Thus , experimental condition contain 36 participant control condition contain 18 participant . Adults T2D live romantic partner , meet current physical activity guideline able willing begin new physical activity ( PA ) routine partner assess baseline , 3 week 6 week experimental manipulation . Partners report investment patient 's goal patient report PA self-efficacy . Patient 's PA measure self-report , partner report accelerometer week prior survey assessment . These specific aim plan : AIM 1 : Determine whether collaborative IIs patient 's PA lead great increase partner investment partner adults T2D individual IIs control . AIM 2 : Determine whether collaborative IIs patient 's PA lead great increase patient PA self-efficacy adult T2D individual IIs control . AIM 3 : Determine whether collaborative IIs patient 's PA lead great increase patient PA adult T2D individual IIs control .
DOC.brief_title: A Couples-based Approach Increasing Physical Activity Among Adults With Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: At least 21 year age Able read understand English Does meet physical activity guideline ( < 150 minute moderatevigorous exercise per week ) last 3 months* ( required one partner ) Diagnosed Type 2 Diabetes* ( require one partner ) Married living romantic partner Medical physical contraindication participate physical activity
